alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 4:59PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 458 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dolores, or 31 miles northwest of Durango, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties, including the following locations... Stoner. This includes Colorado 145 between mile markers 10 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
